#270

- Growing scattered on baqrkless portions of fallen Ash tree in open mixed oak/hickory woodland near edge.
- Caps growing partially resupinately, firm damp, dingy white, bruising dark gray where scratched.
- Hymenium similar color to cap, with tiny round pores, bruising gray where damaged. Some pores elongating as sporocarp thickens.
- Flesh tough and leathery.
- Smell: fragrant/fruity
- Taste: slightly bitter
